  • Prise en charge de 50% du titre de transport – tickets restaurant Swile
  • Prime de vacances et participation
  • Bureaux modernes et spacieux en plein Neuilly-sur-Seine (métro L1 Pont de Neuilly)
  • Ping-pong, terrasse en rooftop, salle de sport, des espaces détente avec canapés, télé pour « gamer », espace « silence », événements et afterwork

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a motivated and analytical Junior Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. In this role, you will be working within the central Data team to derive insights from the group data warehouse for teams across the business. You will be partnering with the finance, marketing and product teams to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize SQL and Python for data analysis and problem solving.
Create and maintain data visualizations for effective storytelling.
Analyze core e-commerce KPIs to influence business strategies.
Ensure data stewardship to deliver accurate and reliable answers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver insights.
Communicate and present complicated data analysis effectively to non-technical users.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience using Python specifically for creating Airflow dags is a plus.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control, GIT is a plus.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days’ holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritise transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Introduction

Are you a natural-born business analyst eager to delve deep into the challenges of the business? Are you passionate about data, its accuracy, and its proper interpretation, and how these contribute to informed management decisions? Do you have a talent for presenting business insights and information through clear visualizations? Then we are looking for you!




Job description

As a business analyst, you act as the bridge between the product owners and the technical BI team. Through workshops and individual discussions, you quickly familiarize yourself with the business domain, analyze business requirements, and ensure their accurate interpretation.
You create visualization proposals and align them with your stakeholders, leveraging your ability to present insights and information clearly.
You translate your findings and analyses into a detailed analysis document.
You engage with application owners and source data owners to design functional data flows. With sufficient technical knowledge, you can ask critical questions.
You support the BI and DWH architect in designing an optimal BI solution.
You describe, plan, and organize functional tests in a concrete test plan, and you actively participate in these tests.
You ensure the quality of datasets and the reporting portfolio, providing clear presentations of datasets and reports while informing the organization and the customer.




Requirements

You have 3-4 years of experience as an analyst conducting functional, process, or business analyses.
You have experience with data modeling techniques and/or other analytical methods.
You communicate fluently and quickly grasp business domains.
Experience in a BI environment or with reporting tools is a plus.
You excel at presenting data attractively using visualization techniques. You value not only accurate data content but also clear and visually engaging presentations.
You are critical and prioritize data accuracy and correct interpretation.
You can work independently and take ownership of your tasks.
You are structured, highly analytical, and capable of setting priorities. You strike the right balance between abstraction and detail.
You work result-oriented with an eye for risks and quality.
You communicate fluently in English.
You hold a master’s degree (e.g., Computer Science, Economics, Business Engineering, Business Information Management) or a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent through experience.




Offer

22 Annual Vacation days, 3 sick days that are not carried over the next year (no medical certificate required), plus a seniority day added every 3 years in the company
Meal tickets
Private Medical Insurance
We offer flexibility when it comes to WFH policy
Wellbeing at the center - we know that there is more to our lives than our jobs, therefore we make sure to tackle well-being aspects of our day-to-day lives through specialized sessions, webinars, and internal programs according to our employee's input
In close cooperation is a value we live by, through #MomentsThatMatter: monthly hangout parties, team buildings, gamified online experiences
Many more to come :)

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and improve. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

What you'll be doing:


Pulling data from multiple different tables, joining and manipulating it to extract insights.
Proactively monitor solution performance and produce reporting on this for internal and external stakeholders.
Produce automated and ad hoc market insights based on clients’ requirements.
Maintenance of documentation for operational processes
Communicate across the analytical and consultancy teams within Experian using all communication channels (face to face, email, telephone etc.)


Qualifications

What you are expected to bring:


University Degree in a quantitative subject as Mathematics, Statistics, Informatics, Economics, Physics or related
Good SQL or Python knowledge
Strong analytical and technical skills and desire to learn.
Very good command of English – both written and spoken


Additional Information

No one makes sense of data like Experian. We are on a mission to deliver the full power of data, analytics and technology in ways that transform lives. As a team, we're committed to working together. So, we work in an inclusive environment that welcomes people with lots of different perspectives. We put people first and care about work that works.

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

What You Will Get


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.


Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst Europe (H/F)
Description:
Entreprise multinationale présente dans plus de 60 pays, nous proposons une gamme complète de services aux acteurs de la distribution automobile. Notre approche repose sur un accompagnement stratégique des réseaux de distribution.

Nous mettons à disposition des services à haute valeur ajoutée, combinant le consulting, des outils informatiques performants et une recherche constante d’optimisation pour renforcer la performance et l'efficacité de nos clients. Dans le cadre du développement d’un projet international d’animation et d’accompagnement des équipes commerciales et après-vente au sein des concessionnaires, nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst Europe.




Mission :

En reporting direct auprès de notre Responsable Solutions Digitales et Innovation, votre mission consiste à accompagner les différents pays dans la production d’analyses de données liées à l’activité permettant aux différents acteurs (constructeur, réseau de distribution, zone Manager, Data Analyst des différents pays, etc.) de piloter et mesurer la performance des activités commerciales de produits additionnels (contrat service et extension de garantie).




Vos principales missions :

Recueillir les besoins d’analyse de données Europe et planifier le développement des reportings, redescendre les informations aux autres pays, transfert et gestion de données
Échanger régulièrement avec les différents interlocuteurs du projet
Accompagner les différents pays dans la production d’analyses et le suivi des Data Analyst
Apporter un soutien à l’équipe dans l’utilisation des outils et la construction d’analyses
Production de documents d’analyse et de synthèse (Volume de ventes, CA, facturation, suivi de plannings etc.) via Power BI
Collecter et compiler les informations quantitatives, chiffrées et qualitatives de l’équipe (réseau, constructeur, itinérants etc.)
Produire et diffuser des analyses des données (création et mise à jour de reportings, tableaux de bords, réalisation de statistiques, extractions etc.)
Suivre les indicateurs et réaliser des comptes rendus sous forme de documents de synthèse ou d’analyse
Accompagnement dans la démarche qualité, contrôle des données
Proposer des axes d'amélioration




Votre profil :

De formation supérieure en école de commerce ou spécialisation en gestion de projet digital, (traitement et analyse de données), vous justifiez d'une expérience significative d'au moins 5 ans (alternance comprise) sur un poste similaire où vous avez développé des compétences en gestion de projet.

En effet, une connaissance pertinente en tant que Data Analyst, en gestion de projet, en production de rapports BI et en automatisation de processus est indispensable. La capacité d'analyse et de synthèse est également essentielle, permettant de comprendre les besoins et problèmes, d'élaborer des solutions, de développer des plans d’action et de traduire les exigences, tout en automatisant les processus et en présentant des analyses claires.




Compétences techniques requises pour ce poste :

Maîtrise avancée de Power BI ainsi que des langages DAX et M utilisés dans cet outil
Power Automate
Power Query
Pack Office, en particulier Excel




Un niveau d'anglais courant est attendu, tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral, avec la capacité de mener des discussions professionnelles et d’animer des réunions en anglais.




Enfin, nous recherchons une personne rigoureuse, respectueuse des processus, méthodes et délais, capable de tester et de vérifier ses productions de manière autonome. Une bonne organisation est cruciale, notamment pour la gestion du temps, des priorités et des délais.







Les bonnes raisons pour nous rejoindre :

L’opportunité de rejoindre une société responsable et internationale.
Rejoindre un groupe de référence disposant d’importants moyens.
L’opportunité d’être formé en continue grâce à un centre de formation interne.
Travailler dans une entreprise qui s’investit pour promouvoir la diversité et l’égalité.
La possibilité d’être autonome et responsable dans un climat de confiance mutuelle.
Vraie harmonie vie pro/vie perso avec une politique de télétravail avantageuse.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues’ needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RIÑG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Alternant(e) - Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Description du poste

Intitulé du poste

Alternant(e) - Data Analyst H/F

Description de la mission

Vous êtes à la recherche d'une opportunité pour développer vos compétences tout en poursuivant vos études ? Chez Groupama Assurances Mutuelles, nous croyons en l'importance de l'alternance pour former les talents de demain. En intégrant notre Groupe, vous bénéficierez d'un environnement de travail stimulant et bienveillant, où vous pourrez mettre en pratique vos connaissances théoriques et acquérir une expérience professionnelle précieuse.

Vous intégrez la Direction Etudes, Tarification et Data, en tant que Data Analyst.

Vos Missions Principales Consisteront à


Participer à la mise en œuvre du Data Management dans le groupe,
Accompagner le déploiement généralisé de l'outil de connaissance de la donnée Collibra et à la prise en main de l'outil par les acteurs Data dans le groupe,
Participer aux travaux de peuplement de l'outil de connaissance de la donnée Collibra avec les données du modèle d'entreprise,
Rédiger les supports de formation des PDD et des RDD à l'outil Collibra,
Participer aux travaux d'acculturation Data à travers la mise en place de supports de formation, de modules de e-learning et de vidéos de vulgarisation de la Data Gouvernance,
Participer au maintien et à la mise à jour régulière du référentiel des domaines et objets métiers modélisés et à modéliser,
Participer aux travaux de modélisation entreprise des projets,
Plus globalement, contribuer aux travaux de mise en œuvre de la Data Gouvernance dans le groupe.


#Alternance #DataManagement

Profil

Vous êtes étudiant(e) et préparez un Bac +4/5 en Data, Management ou Data Analyse.

Ce Que Nous Attendons De Vous


Connaissance des outils de gestion de données, notamment Collibra.
Maîtrise des concepts de Data Management et Data Gouvernance ;
Capacité à analyser et interpréter des données complexes ;
Bonnes compétences en communication écrite et orale ;
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec différents acteurs.

HTML:
Description du poste

Intitulé du poste

Alternant(e) - Data Analyst H/F

Description de la mission

Vous êtes à la recherche d'une opportunité pour développer vos compétences tout en poursuivant vos études ? Chez Groupama Assurances Mutuelles, nous croyons en l'importance de l'alternance pour former les talents de demain. En intégrant notre Groupe, vous bénéficierez d'un environnement de travail stimulant et bienveillant, où vous pourrez mettre en pratique vos connaissances théoriques et acquérir une expérience professionnelle précieuse.

Vous intégrez la Direction Etudes, Tarification et Data, en tant que Data Analyst.

Vos Missions Principales Consisteront à

  • Participer à la mise en œuvre du Data Management dans le groupe,
  • Accompagner le déploiement généralisé de l'outil de connaissance de la donnée Collibra et à la prise en main de l'outil par les acteurs Data dans le groupe,
  • Participer aux travaux de peuplement de l'outil de connaissance de la donnée Collibra avec les données du modèle d'entreprise,
  • Rédiger les supports de formation des PDD et des RDD à l'outil Collibra,
  • Participer aux travaux d'acculturation Data à travers la mise en place de supports de formation, de modules de e-learning et de vidéos de vulgarisation de la Data Gouvernance,
  • Participer au maintien et à la mise à jour régulière du référentiel des domaines et objets métiers modélisés et à modéliser,
  • Participer aux travaux de modélisation entreprise des projets,
  • Plus globalement, contribuer aux travaux de mise en œuvre de la Data Gouvernance dans le groupe.

#Alternance #DataManagement

Profil

Vous êtes étudiant(e) et préparez un Bac +4/5 en Data, Management ou Data Analyse.

Ce Que Nous Attendons De Vous

  • Connaissance des outils de gestion de données, notamment Collibra.
  • Maîtrise des concepts de Data Management et Data Gouvernance ;
  • Capacité à analyser et interpréter des données complexes ;
  • Bonnes compétences en communication écrite et orale ;
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec différents acteurs.

Title: Data Analist Assortiment
Description:
Data Analist Assortiment bij Albert Heijn

Zaandam - 40 uur per week

Wil jij graag bepalen welke producten in onze winkels gevoerd worden en jouw werk terugzien op de schappen in meer dan 1.250 winkels? Zie jij jezelf daarbij meewerken aan gave projecten op het snijvlak van commercie en analytics? En ben je op zoek naar een leuk team waar hard werken in combinatie gaat met humor en gezelligheid? Dan is deze baan zeker iets voor jou!




Albert Heijn vult met 125.000 collega’s, verdeeld over ruim 1.250 winkels in Nederland en Vlaanderen, negen home shop centers, zeven distributiecentra en ons hoofdkantoor elke avond ruim zeven miljoen borden.




Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek.

Als Data Analist Assortiment bij Albert Heijn maak jij impact door te zorgen dat het juiste assortiment op de beste plek in de schappen van onze ruim 1.250 winkels wordt gepresenteerd. Je werkt op het snijvlak van het belang van de klant, commercie en onze winkels. Een uitdagende rol, waarbij je als belangrijke drijver achter grote assortimentsveranderingen nadenkt over hoe we iedere klant optimaal kunnen bedienen, zo veel mogelijk resultaat kunnen behalen én tegelijkertijd zo min mogelijk producten hoeven af te prijzen of weg te gooien. En dit doen we door continue bij te sturen. Dit alles doe je natuurlijk niet alleen: je werkt veel samen met de afdeling Commercie om kansen te presenteren en initiatieven te ontwikkelen en Analytics om onze assortiment modellen te verbeteren. Met jouw focus op ons assortiment, haarscherpe analyses en lef ben je in staat om vernieuwende inzichten te geven, de juiste partijen bij elkaar te brengen én zorg je dat alle doelen op tijd worden gerealiseerd. Je bent hierbij dé sparringpartner van de Category Manager op het gebied van assortiment: je denkt met hem/haar mee en stuurt hierbij op het juiste eindresultaat. Dat komt neer op een ideale mix van een commerciële mindset, de wil om te blijven verbeteren waarbij je een beroep kan doen op jouw skills in projectmanagement en procesbewaking.




In deze functie werk je 40 uur per week, deels vanuit het hoofdkantoor in Zaandam en deels vanuit huis.




Dit ga je als Data Analist Assortiment bij ons doen.

Je signaleert continue kansen op het gebied van assortiment en zet deze om tot concrete inzichten en acties tijdens integrale ‘deep-dives’.
Je bent de sparringpartner voor bijvoorbeeld Category Managers. Je neemt hen mee en overtuigt hen van met vernieuwende inzichten of voorstellen als het gaat om continue het juiste assortiment voor klant en winkel bieden.
Je analyseert het assortiment op basis van performance data en gebruikt daarvoor big data-applicaties zoals PowerBI en Assortiment Optimization. Hiermee vertaal je de data in specifieke assortimentsadviezen.
Je weet verzoeken vanuit Commercie voor schapanalyse en ruimteverdeling te vertalen naar kansen en commerciële plannen en draagt zorg voor de implementatie daarvan.
Je stuurt continu op kansen in assortiment. Denk aan assortiment met hoge derving, lage marge, kansen op biologisch of producten met een slechte beschikbaarheid.
Je biedt end-to-end begeleiding bij het proces voor veranderingen van assortiment in de winkel waarbij je verschillende afdelingen binnen Albert Heijn (Concept Development, Winkel Support, Merchandising, Strategy en Analytics) aanhaakt, informeert en samenbrengt.




We vinden het belangrijk dat jij bij Albert Heijn jezelf kunt zijn in een omgeving die openstaat voor verschillende perspectieven, een omgeving waarin we nieuwsgierig zijn en elkaar waarderen. Voor deze functie zoeken we bij voorkeur iemand die de diversiteit in ons team, in de breedste zin van het woord, versterkt. Iemand die vanuit eigen achtergrond en persoonlijke eigenschappen een ander geluid brengt en daarmee een goede aanvulling is op ons team.




Dit bieden we jou.

We betalen je inzet terug met een bruto jaarsalaris tussen €50.800 en €61.700 - afhankelijk van je ervaring. Dit bedrag is inclusief 8% vakantiegeld.
Je werkt mee aan onze groei en ontvangt daarom een gegarandeerde winstuitkering.
Je kunt 45 (ja, vijf-en-veertig) dagen met vakantie: je krijgt 25,5 vaste vakantiedagen en 19,5 Adv-dagen.
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling bij het Ahold Delhaize Pensioenfonds.
Een reiskostenvergoeding of NS-trajectkaart om van en naar Zaandam te reizen.
10% korting op je boodschappen bij Albert Heijn, tot maximaal €300 per jaar.
Verdere doorgroeimogelijkheden in de Albert Heijn en/of Ahold Delhaize organisatie.
Een Mijn Albert Heijn Premium abonnement met vele voordelen.
Via onze Albert Heijn Deals ontvang je exclusieve kortingen op leuke uitjes en producten van grote merken.
Een inclusieve omgeving waarin je op persoonlijk en vakinhoudelijk vlak continu kan blijven ontwikkelen.




Dit breng je mee.

Met onze 125.000 collega’s vullen we elke avond ruim zeven miljoen borden. En als het aan ons ligt, doen we dat binnenkort ook samen met jou als onze nieuwe Data Analist Assortiment. Zeker als je jouw commerciële kennis en analytische blik naar Albert Heijn meebrengt. Ook heb je:

Een afgeronde WO-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van Economie of Bedrijfskunde.
Circa 3-5 jaar werkervaring liefst in een commerciële, trade marketing of consulting rol.
Je hebt affiniteit met assortiment en presentatie, kwantitatieve analyses en automatiseringssoftware
Je bent thuis in een Retail- of FMCG-omgeving.
Ervaring met Consultancy en/of onze winkels is een flink pluspunt.
Als je, net als wij, graag onderdeel bent van een team dat hard werken combineert met humor en gezelligheid, helemaal top!




Daarnaast ben je:

Analytisch, een must voor deze baan! Je kan snel problemen en oorzaken onderkennen, je ziet samenhang tussen onderwerpen, software en behoudt structuur en overzicht. Je interpreteert grote datasets en vertaalt deze naar inzichten richting de business en naar regels voor modellen.
Een denker in oplossingen en lekker proactief, je deinst niet terug voor complexe uitdagingen op het snijvlak van business, software en algoritmes.
Resultaatgericht: je weet concrete commerciële resultaten en/of doelstellingen te behalen. Je geeft niet op bij tegenslagen en houdt de uitgezette lijn voor ogen.
Overtuigend, je kan verschillende stakeholders overtuigen van onderbouwde ideeën en houdt daarbij rekening met mogelijke weerstand. Ook ben je in staat een boodschap krachtig, doelgericht en duidelijk over te brengen.
Flexibel/wendbaar en in staat je (snel) aan te passen aan veranderende omstandigheden of werkwijze, blijft daarbij kalm en houdt overzicht.
Verbindend, je bent je bewust van anderen, kan effectief de samenwerking opzoeken en verwachtingen van collega’s begrijpen en hier het eigen gedrag waar nodig op aanpassen.
Ondernemend, je wacht ontwikkelingen niet af, maar bent proactief en onderneemt zelf actie en stelt zaken ter discussie.




Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen.

Bij Albert Heijn geloven we dat eten en drinken een essentiële rol speelt bij de grote uitdagingen in de maatschappij. Het levert een belangrijke bijdrage aan een gezonde levensstijl, het verbindt mensen en draagt bij aan een beter klimaat en daarmee een duurzame samenleving. Onze missie is dan ook: Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen. Albert Heijn Nederland is B Corp gecertificeerd. Deze certificering onderstreept onze missie waarmee het een bijdrage levert aan een gezonde, sociale en duurzame samenleving. De B Corp certificering wordt toegekend aan bedrijven die voldoen aan hoge normen voor sociale- en milieuprestaties, transparantie en wettelijke verantwoordelijkheid.




Ben jij er klaar voor om deze missie samen waar te maken?

Klik op de sollicitatiebutton en laat jouw cv en motivatiebrief achter. Dat kan ook als je nét niet alle artikelen van ons boodschappenlijstje in huis hebt.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role & responsibilities




Should be good at requirement gathering, documentation, presentation, and interaction with business stakeholders.
Should be capable to interact with developers and testers to build complex logic in EDW.
Technical knowledge of data models and database design.
Good knowledge of Teradata/SQL and writing little complex scripts proficiently
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Working with different stake holders to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data strategies.
Stakeholder engagement to develop existing artefacts in a clear interpretation of Data usage across each business and function
Should be capable of doing Business Acceptance Test/User acceptance test and System Integration test. Will be required to transform the business requirement into scripts.
Should be capable of doing AS-IS, TO-BE and Gap analysis.
Having worked in corporate banking/finance in Data space in the past will be helpful.




Experience & Skills:




Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst for at least 5 years.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (JavaScript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience of working in both Agile & waterfall SDLCs
Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate technical issues and strategy to both technical and non-technical audiences at senior levels within the bank. Interpersonal skills - collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation skills
Ability to work to strict deadlines and under pressure, deal with competing priorities
Excellent decision making & problem-solving skills. Ability to work on own initiative and being proactive.
Excellent organizational & prioritizing skills

  • Excellent organizational & prioritizing skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Van Caem Klerks Group is seeking a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer. You will be responsible for maintenance and further development of our Data Platform, reports and apps in Power BI, in-house built Python applications and user support.




Requirements

Fluent in English.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer/Data Engineer.
Proficiency in SQL.
Data modelling knowledge.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with people of different skill sets.
Knowledge of ETL/ELT.




Nice-to-haves

Experience with PowerBI.
Experience with dbt.
Experience with Azure.




Recruitment process

Get to know each other: you will have a 30-minute talk with our Analytics Engineer. This will lead to get to know each other and learning more about Van Caem Klerks Group and the Data Team's role within the company.
Technical assessment: during a longer assessment, around 1 hour, you will connect with our Analytics Engineer. You will discuss the technical side of the team's work. You also may be given a challenge, which can focus more on applying your skills than theoretical knowledge. For example, you may be asked to complete a SQL coding challenge.
Final call

Show more

Van Caem Klerks Group is seeking a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer. You will be responsible for maintenance and further development of our Data Platform, reports and apps in Power BI, in-house built Python applications and user support.


Requirements

  • Fluent in English.
  • At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Engineer/Data Engineer.
  • Proficiency in SQL.
  • Data modelling knowledge.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work with people of different skill sets.
  • Knowledge of ETL/ELT.


Nice-to-haves

  • Experience with PowerBI.
  • Experience with dbt.
  • Experience with Azure.


Recruitment process

  • Technical assessment: during a longer assessment, around 1 hour, you will connect with our Analytics Engineer. You will discuss the technical side of the team's work. You also may be given a challenge, which can focus more on applying your skills than theoretical knowledge. For example, you may be asked to complete a SQL coding challenge.
  • Final call

Title: Data analyst junior (H/F/X)
Description:
Description De L'entreprise

Vous rejoindrez l'une des plus grandes marketplace immobilière au monde et une filiale d'Axel Springer. Notre mission est de permettre à chacun de trouver un logement idéal ! Vous travaillerez ainsi sur certaines des marques immobilières numériques les plus connues d'Europe, notamment : Meilleurs Agents, Groupe SeLoger, Immoweb, Immowelt, Housell, Yad2.

Description Du Poste

Rattaché à la Crédit Manager , elle-même rattachée à la directrice financière France, vos principales missions seront les suivantes:


Data crunching :
Gestion et mise à jour de fichiers Excel avec requêtes actualisables pour le service Recouvrement au quotidien
Import des données dans l’ERP
Extraction SQL diverses
Cross- check de la cohérence des datas en fonction des sources
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Credit Manager et l’ équipe Cash Collection sur les besoins en matière d'analyse de données et de reporting.
Développer des tableaux de bord via Power BI- TABLEAU
Collecter, nettoyer et mettre en forme des KPI de performance ( cash collecté, litiges, Churn, Top 40, dossiers CTX ) et d’’activité du Recouvrement ( Flux entrants / sortants, dossiers à envoyer agences recouvrement ou avocats )
Préparation des fichiers mensuels W/O et deck investisseurs
Rédiger les modes opératoires nécessaires à la continuité d’activité.


Qualifications


profil Bac+4/+5 de type École de commerce/ Ecole d’ingénieurs/ Mastère Universitaire spécialisation Data, data analytics
Parfaite maîtrise d'Excel, et de l'ensemble du Pack Office.
Maîtrise de Power Bi (Office 365), VBA.
Python et SQL seraient un plus
Esprit d'analyse, organisation, rigueur, force de proposition, autonomie, travail en équipe et curiosité, seront les traits de caractère essentiels pour mener à bien vos missions.


Informations supplémentaires

Ce que vous allez adorer chez nous 🤩


Un fort esprit d'équipe
Une brillante équipe avec laquelle collaborer pour relever de beaux challenges

Vous rejoindrez l'une des plus grandes marketplace immobilière au monde et une filiale d'Axel Springer. Notre mission est de permettre à chacun de trouver un logement idéal ! Vous travaillerez ainsi sur certaines des marques immobilières numériques les plus connues d'Europe, notamment : Meilleurs Agents, Groupe SeLoger, Immoweb, Immowelt, Housell, Yad2.

Description Du Poste

Rattaché à la Crédit Manager , elle-même rattachée à la directrice financière France, vos principales missions seront les suivantes:

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US

Established in 1973, EU Business School (EU) is an international, professionally accredited, high-ranking business school with campuses in Barcelona, Geneva, Munich and Digital. We offer foundation, bachelor’s, master’s, MBA, DBA and further education programs which focus on business administration. In 2022, EU Business School joined forces with OMNES Education Group.




ABOUT THE JOB

We’re looking for a Data analyst to join our dynamic, international team on our offices at the Barcelona campus. You’ll need to have a passion for data analysis, online marketing and enjoy working in multi-cultural fast-paced environment, demonstrating the ability to identify growth opportunities with excellent optimization skills. You’ll also have to be very well organized, with a results-oriented approach.




Responsibilities

As a Data analyst inside the EU Online Marketing Department, your responsibilities will include:

Design, build, and maintain the Online Marketing department's reporting, ensuring that data across all areas (web, digital acquisition, email marketing, etc.) is accurate and easy to interpret.
Continuously monitor data sources, including Zapier connections, forms, and file uploads, to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Identify new data points needed to improve data traceability and reporting capabilities.
Analyse performance data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities for optimization across the funnel.
Communicate actionable insights and key findings to the entire marketing team, helping drive data-driven decision-making.




Qualifications and Skills

2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a digital marketing or online marketing environment.
Strong proficiency in Power BI and HubSpot reporting tools.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience working with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools (HubSpot and Microsoft Dynamics preferred).
Familiarity with Google Analytics, paid media platforms (Google Ads, Meta Ads, etc.), and email marketing metrics.
Ability to interpret complex datasets and present insights in a clear and actionable way.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail to ensure data accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with marketing teams and translate data into strategic recommendations.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple reporting projects simultaneously.




ABOUT YOU

You have a scientific background with computational and analytical skills
At least two years of experience working on a similar position.
Critical thinker and adept problem solver.
Self-sufficient and proactive with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to multitask effectively.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Fluent in English, good presenter and communicator.
Open to feedback and able to adapt to new opportunities in an agile manner.
Team player.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced, international environment, demonstrating your ability to identify growth opportunities and improve our digital performance.




Please include your CV in English along demonstrating your experience or skills in your application.




At EU Business School, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where everyone is valued and respected. Our hiring practices ensure equal opportunities for all candidates, and we actively promote a workplace that is accessible, supportive, and free from discrimination.

We believe that diverse perspectives drive innovation and success, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in creating a more inclusive future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your digital journey starts here!




Create. Grow. Deliver our story to millions.

#BTCode, where technology meets creativity. Code is our universal language and innovation is the fuel that propels us into the future. 🚀




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team.

This role involves working closely with business stakeholders to understand and document their requirements, analyze data, and support the development of data warehouse (DW) structures and reporting solutions.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Document detailed requirements for data warehouse developments, ensuring clarity and completeness.
Work closely with DW developers to design and validate new data structures required for reporting and analytics.
Test data structures during system migrations to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and alignment with business requirements.
Develop and execute test cases and validate results to confirm the success of data migration or transformation processes.
Maintain comprehensive documentation in tools like Confluence, detailing data requirements, solutions, and testing processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, data engineers, and external vendors, to deliver high-quality solutions.
Actively use Jira and Clarity to track tasks, document progress, and ensure timely delivery of projects.
Ensure adherence to data governance policies and maintain high standards for data accuracy and security.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis and reporting.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and insights as needed to support decision-making processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data-related issues.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, with a focus on data (1 year).
Experience with data warehouse development and reporting.
Good with SQL for data extraction and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Qlik Sense).
Knowledge of Jira, Confluence, and Clarity.
Understanding of data modeling and ETL processes.




If you want to find out what other jobs we still have available, like Life at BT or what #Culture BT is, you can also access the Bank's career website: https://cariere.bancatransilvania.ro/ .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst (Fashion Days Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Fashion Days through eMAG IT is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Fashion Days Platform Team. We need a person with background in Data Analysis to help us leverage data to enhance our customer experience and satisfaction. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.


What you’ll have to do:

  • Gather, aggregate and analyze data from various sources, such as internal databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery to provide insights and support decision-making processes;
  • Work closely with your colleagues in improving the current tracking and develop new flows according to business needs;
  • Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and insights in customer journey (such as traffic sources, conversion rates, purchase frequency);
  • Perform regularly data checks to ensure data accuracy, integrity and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using data visualization tools to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Work together with product and marketing teams to provide data-driven recommendations for improving user experience;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics, tracking and user behavior analysis.


How we’d like you to be:

  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience;
  • Have 2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Detail-oriented and able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).


Nice to have:

  • Knowledge of Big Query and Google Analytics;
  • Familiarity with Python;
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Looker Studio.


What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.




Job Description




Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success




Job Purpose




As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.




Main Duties:




Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor’s Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures







Qualifications




Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment




What We Offer:




A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.




Additional Information




If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.




Location and Availability Requirements:




Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS




What It’s Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

  • Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
  • Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
  • Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
  • Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
  • Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
  • Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
  • Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
  • Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
  • Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
  • Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment


What We Offer:


  • A dynamic and supportive work environment.
  • Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
  • Collaboration with a talented, international team.


Additional Information


If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.


Location and Availability Requirements:


  • Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
  • 39 working hours/ week
  • Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS


What It’s Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
About the Role:

We are looking for a data wizard to join our Data Analytics team as part of our Data & Advanced Analytics department.

As a data analyst you will interact with data warehouse developers, data engineers and other key stakeholders to maintain the data ecosystem up to date and we are counting on your curiosity and technical knowledge to extract actionable insights from terabytes of data.



Responsibilities:

  • Key role in creating and maintaining dashboards using Power BI that display key performance indicators which are used across the company;
  • Work closely with analysts from other departments on defining and implementing solutions for new reporting needs, offer support regarding data inquiries;
  • Leverage analytical applications to translate data into stories and explain the meaningful conclusions of the analysis in written verbal and visual form;
  • Answer to ad-hoc data requests.


Requirements:

  • 3+ years of relevant analytical experience in a Data Analyst/Reporting Analyst/Business Intelligence Developer position;
  • Previous experience using SQL to manipulate large volumes of data;
  • Previous experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau or Qlik);
  • Ability to be flexible and work analytically in a problem-solving environment;
  • Ability to present data analysis results using storytelling capabilities;
  • Ability to work independently while prioritizing multiple projects and tasks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.




Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.




We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.







Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.




Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you.




We are looking for a

Data Analyst




Full Time | Amersfoort




As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.




You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.




Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.




In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.




What will you be doing:

Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business







What will you bring?

At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
Experience in building and maintaining data models
Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
Fluent in English




Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.




Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:

Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.




BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Title: Analista de dados
HTML:
Data Analyst Sénior(m/f)

O El Corte Inglés Grandes Armazéns chegou a Portugal em 2001 e, desde aí, protagonizou a revolução no comércio de retalho.

Comprometemo-nos, diariamente, em oferecer produtos e serviços de qualidade aos nossos clientes. Para dar sentido a esta missão, precisamos das melhores pessoas (como tu) a colaborar connosco, naquele que é o nosso maior desafio diário – sermos especialistas em qualquer que seja a área de negócio.

A nossa cultura é feita por cada um de nós. Somos dedicação, lealdade, diversidade, igualdade, responsabilidade social, educação, resiliência, inovação e, acima de tudo, somos apaixonados por tudo aquilo que fazemos e construímos.

Desde Dezembro de 2021 somos, também, a primeira empresa reconhecida como Marca Entidade Empregadora Inclusiva – Excelência, pela gestão e práticas inclusivas a pessoas com deficiência e incapacidade.

Para integrar a Direção de Transformação Digital, área de Data & Automation, procuramos um/a Data Analyst Sénior que terá como principal missão apoiar o negócio numa cultura de dados.

O que farás connosco?

  • Desenvolver e monitorizar relatórios e dashboards para dar suporte à decisão;
  • Monitorizar a integridade e consistência dos dados;
  • Fazer automatização de reports;
  • Colaborar com outros membros da equipa de Dados para projetar e implementar soluções analíticas.

O que esperamos de ti?

  • Formação superior em áreas quantitativas ou similares (Engenharias, Matemática, Estatística, Data Science ou Gestão de Informação);
  • Experiência profissional anterior de pelo menos 5 anos (preferencial);
  • Conhecimentos em SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Power BI;
  • Conhecimentos em Python (valorizado);
  • Excelentes capacidades de apresentação de dados;
  • Forte orientação para o negócio utilizando os dados para resolver problemas e encontrar soluções;
  • Boa capacidade de comunicação;
  • Espírito de equipa;
  • Dedicação e sentido de responsabilidade.

O que podes esperar de nós?

  • Integração numa equipa jovem e dinâmica;
  • Projetos inovadores e diferenciadores;
  • Formação inicial e contínua;
  • Conjunto de benefícios (nomeadamente, 3 dias de férias extra, dia do aniversário, protocolos e parcerias com várias instituições, descontos exclusivos para colaboradores, entre outros);
  • Trabalho em regime híbrido.

Acreditamos ainda que, connosco, terás a oportunidade certa para cresceres, para te desenvolveres e partilhares as tuas experiências.

Temos histórias diferentes, mas um propósito em comum. Junta-te a nós!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Data Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion
