Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.




Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.




We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial
Exceptional ability to work with the business to understand the business process and reporting purpose
Excellent ability to translate existing data & dashboards requirements into effective new solutions
Optimal and efficient use of Qlik Sense to create visualizations; building sheets, create KPIs, build complex formulas, dynamic charts etc
Creates accurate, easy to digest/interpret solutions, adhering to internal guidelines
Collaborates effectively with the team to fill knowledge gaps and request support
Uses their initiative to problem solve
Proactively conducts test and validation of dashboard functionality & insights, ensuring data accuracy and integrity of the solution
Manages the UAT process by engaging with business users
Provides input and support to the wider team into best practice for report development
Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology
Exceptional analytical and time management skills
Exceptional communication skills




At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

Competitive salary
Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
Several discounts available with our partners
Training and international career progression plan upon hiring
Dynamic and enthusiastic work environment with colleagues from more than 60 countries
The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
If you are moving to Portugal, we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
Remote Working Available
An IKEA voucher to help you build your own home office
…and much more!

Show more
HTML:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.


Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.


We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

  • Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
  • An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial
  • Exceptional ability to work with the business to understand the business process and reporting purpose
  • Excellent ability to translate existing data & dashboards requirements into effective new solutions
  • Optimal and efficient use of Qlik Sense to create visualizations; building sheets, create KPIs, build complex formulas, dynamic charts etc
  • Creates accurate, easy to digest/interpret solutions, adhering to internal guidelines
  • Collaborates effectively with the team to fill knowledge gaps and request support
  • Uses their initiative to problem solve
  • Proactively conducts test and validation of dashboard functionality & insights, ensuring data accuracy and integrity of the solution
  • Manages the UAT process by engaging with business users
  • Provides input and support to the wider team into best practice for report development
  • Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
  • Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology
  • Exceptional analytical and time management skills
  • Exceptional communication skills


At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

  • Competitive salary
  • Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
  • Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
  • Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
  • International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
  • Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
  • Several discounts available with our partners
  • Training and international career progression plan upon hiring
  • Dynamic and enthusiastic work environment with colleagues from more than 60 countries
  • The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
  • Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
  • If you are moving to Portugal, we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
  • Remote Working Available
  • An IKEA voucher to help you build your own home office
  • …and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!

Learn more jti.com

Data Analyst

What This Position Is About - Purpose

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data from various sources to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions. This role focuses on web analytics and data analysis to optimize website performance, enhance user experience, and support marketing and product initiatives. The analyst will create detailed reports and visualizations, identify trends and patterns, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven strategies are effectively implemented. The ultimate goal is to leverage data to improve business outcomes and support the company's growth objectives

What Will You Do - Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze data from various sources, including web analytics, databases, and CRM systems
Monitor and analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar platforms. Provide insights to optimize website performance, user experience, and marketing campaigns
Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders
Create clear and compelling data visualizations to present complex data in an understandable manner
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data audits and validation
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to provide actionable recommendations
Work closely with internal Brand, Consumer Activation, Sales, Finance, Legal HQ/ DBU and IT teams, as well as with 3rd parties, digital agencies, web and software developers who contribute to aligned KPIs


Who Are We Looking For - Requirements


University degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Min. 2 years of experience in data analysis, web analytics, or a related role
English - very good (both verbal and written)
Proficiency in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy


What To Expect


Full-time employment contract
Professional onboarding during your first months at JTI
Individual approach to your development plan including certified trainings organized by both external and internal trainers
Opportunity to work in open atmosphere in modern office in a group of team-players
Attractive package of benefits, including among others private healthcare, sport-card, life insurance, pension plan (when you are here, check our cafeteria system!)
Work in a 50/50 hybrid system model


Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

Next Steps

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure Phone screening with Talent Advisor > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

At JTI, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you need any specific support, alternative formats, or have other access requirements, please let us know.

If you decide to participate in this recruitment, the administrator of your data will be JTI Polska sp.z o.o. with headquarters in Stary Gostków. Your data will be processed only to support the recruitment process in which you participate. Detailed information on the processing of your data here.

Procedure on internal breaches reporting and follow–up procedure for JTI Polska regulating the rules for whistleblowers reporting is available at https //do.jti.pl/sygnalisci.pdf.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Skill Development!




Work on impactful, AI-driven projects
Enhance your technical expertise in a supportive environment
Gain exposure across multiple business domains




Applicants must have a Stamp 4 visa or an EU Passport




Join a well-established Irish company known for its stability and commitment to long-term employee development. This is a unique opportunity for a Data Analyst to refine their skills in a collaborative setting while working across multiple domains. The company has a strong track record of retaining its employees, offering a secure and supportive work environment.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making, utilizing cutting-edge AI-powered insights and industry-leading tools such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Python. You will work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst with over 20 years of industry expertise, ensuring continuous learning, mentorship, and professional growth.




If you are eager to expand your expertise, contribute to impactful projects, and be part of a company that values long-term career progression, this is the perfect opportunity for you.




You will:

Utilize AI-driven analytics to enhance business efficiency and outcomes.
Strengthen your expertise in SQL and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies.
Translate complex datasets into actionable insights for key stakeholders.
Thrive in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment with strong career prospects.




Skills/Experience:

2–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with hands-on experience in Power BI and Tableau.
Excellent communication skills, to present insights effectively to stakeholders.




Salary / Remuneration:

€35.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

About Archer – Archer Recruitment is a Specialist IT Recruitment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Develop Your CRM Expertise!




Exciting career growth opportunities
Flexible and collaborative work environment
Enhance your technical skills in CRM and data analytics




This is a unique opportunity to join a highly regarded Irish organization known for excellence and innovation. As a CRM Data Analyst, you will be essential in delivering accurate reporting and valuable insights to drive strategic business decisions.




As a CRM Data Analyst, you will extract and analyse data from Aptify, uncover trends, and enhance automation processes. You will also provide data-driven support, working with Power BI, Excel, and CRM systems to optimize reporting and business insights.




If you are a junior data analyst eager to expand your expertise in CRM systems while working in a supportive and dynamic environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Manage and enhance reports and automation systems using Power BI.
Extract and analyse data to provide actionable insights – Aptify CRM.
Identify trends in customer and member behaviours.
Support team members with data-related queries and reporting needs.
Maintain and improve automation processes for efficiency.




Skills/Experience:

Proficiency in Power BI, Excel (Advanced), and VBA.
Experience working with CRM databases.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.




Salary / Remuneration:

€40,000 - €46,000

Paid sick leave, 20-day AL, pension plan, discount on gym, 5% bonus!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst | Teletrabajo
Description:
En OPTIMISSA tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 5 años de experiencia como Analista de Datos, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué buscamos?

Perfil con experiencia como analista de datos, con conocimientos sólidos en creación de informes y dashboards interactivos mediante PowerBI.
Experiencia en procesamiento de datos y visualización de datos.
Experiencia en extracción de insights de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Experiencia con creación de reportes y dashboards en Power BI
Experiencia con Excel.
Generación de informes periódicos










¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Modalidad 100% remota.
Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

You support to migrate current developed reports from Tableau On-premises to Tableau Cloud.
You collaborate with your data science team to smoothly switch reporting used data source from Microsoft SQL Server to Microsoft Azure.
You rebuild current developed reports with modern look and feel.
You reconfigure current developed reports if any business logics are changed while migration.
You develop new reports to support customers’ needs.
You work in a cross functional agile environment with an international team.
You stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, business intelligence, etc.




Requirements:

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Statistics, Business informatics, Econometrics or any related discipline.
You are fully skilled with Tableau, ideally certificated with “Tableau Certified Data Analyst” or higher.
You are experienced in Tableau environment and familiar with the DAX functions.
You bring work experience in any relevant field, ideally 5 years at least in similar analytical context with relevant quests for ITSM. (e.g. Incident Management, Problem Management, etc.) or CMDB (Configuration Management Database)
You are experienced in working in agile team and you can proactively explore and communicate findings.
You bring a strong expertise in cloud as well as on-premises storage systems. (preferably MS SQL Server and Azure services)
You have an analytical mindset with strong knowledge, and you are capable of communicating findings through the cross functional team.
You are fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with reference “VR/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

At HubSpot, we aim to help businesses grow better every day. We are looking for highly skilled Data Analysts to join our team!

Job Summary

We have a number of Analyst positions open at various levels of seniority across a range of focus areas, including; EMEA Sales Strategy & Operations, Global / EMEA Sales & Marketing Planning, Global Insights & Analytics and Global Partner / Channel Strategy & Operations.

In these roles you will be combining deep data insights with business expertise to deliver comprehensive solutions that tackle critical challenges and enhance both operational efficiency and strategic outcomes. Some of our analyst roles are more specialised. Our recruitment team will help match your experience to these roles and determine the best fit.

About The Team

Revenue Operations partners with GTM leadership to drive daily business and achieve long-term strategic priorities. We use a data-driven approach to solve complex issues and drive business planning from strategy to execution.

Key Responsibilities


Be the go-to expert for the business, playing a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making
Participate in and develop the analyst community, fostering a high-performing, insights-driven culture
Be hands-on, delivering critical insights that shape strategic decisions and ensure data is at the core of our operations
Partner with leadership to drive business strategy, planning, goal-setting, and performance tracking
Scope and lead high-impact projects and execute on mission-critical strategic initiatives


These roles offer significant exposure to HubSpot C-suite and growth opportunities. If you thrive in a high-impact, strategic role and want to shape the future of the business, we’d love to hear from you.

Qualifications


A minimum number of years experience in a sales strategy role or equivalent level position:
Analyst - Min. 2 Years
Senior Analyst - 4+ Years
Demonstrated expertise in analytical or modeling techniques using tools like Looker, Hex, or Google Suite.
Strong aptitude for defining key metrics and conducting analyses to derive actionable insights.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of presenting to revenue-driven executives.
Strong capability to identify personal and professional growth opportunities and willingness to expand beyond baseline responsibilities.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite, Google Apps, Salesforce.com, and HubSpot CRM.
Proven SQL knowledge and experience.
Python or R is a plus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous working environment.


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

If you need accommodations or assistance due to a disability, please reach out to us using this form. This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.

At HubSpot, we value both flexibility and connection. Whether you’re a Remote employee, or work from the Office, we want you to start your journey here by building strong connections with your team and peers. If you are joining our Engineering team, you will be required to attend a regional HubSpot office for in-person onboarding. If you join our broader Product team, you’ll also attend other in-person events such as your Product Group Summit and other gatherings to continue building on those connections.

If you require an accommodation due to travel limitations or other reasons, please inform your recruiter during the hiring process. We are committed to supporting candidates who may need alternative arrangements

Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

India Applicants: link to HubSpot India's equal opportunity policy here.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022 and has been recognized for its award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees across the globe work remotely and in HubSpot offices. Visit our careers website to learn more about the culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.

Title: Data analyst | Mid
HTML:
The Data, Research, and Insights department possesses a growth mindset based on insightful data. We enjoy performing statistical analyses with Looker, BigQuery, Google Analytics, and Tableau to conclude product or customer experience improvement.

About the role: we are looking for a Data analyst to turn the data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will analyze trends, create reports, and collaborate cross-functionally to support data-driven strategies. The ideal candidate is both data-driven and results-driven, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Main Responsibilities

  • Help define KPIs and monitor them in automated reports and dashboards;
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities;
  • Present findings in a clear, compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation and governance;
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with other departments to help them track the results, find valuable insights, and deliver data-driven decisions




Core Requirements

  • You have demonstrated experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing complex data using SQL;
  • You are interested in data storytelling and have hands-on experience with BI tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI) and statistical analysis methods;
  • You have strong communication and collaboration skills;
  • You are attentive to detail;
  • Experience with SaaS products will be a big advantage




Tools you will use

  • Google Bigquery, Looker, Google Analytics 4, GS / Excel




Salary range

  • Gross Salary 2200-4500 EUR/month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.
NordLayer is an adaptive network access security solution for modern businesses developed by the standard of NordVPN.

We help organizations of all sizes enhance their internet security and modernize network and resource access with technical improvements aligning with the best regulatory compliance standards. Helping organizations to adopt ZTNA principles, NordLayer is focused on the Security Service Edge of cybersecurity services.

Quick and easy to integrate with existing infrastructure, hardware-free, and designed with ease of scale in mind, NordLayer meets the varying growth pace and ad-hoc cybersecurity requirements of agile businesses and distributed workforces today.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, online and on-site workouts, consultations to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • More free time. Stay with us and additional vacation days will be added to your calendar;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
📢 Oportunidade: Senior Data Analytics

📍 Localização: Lisboa

🌍 Regime Laboral: Híbrido (3 dias x presencial, 2 dias remoto)

📄 Tipo de Contrato: Full-time


Um cliente está a criar uma nova área de Data Analytics com impacto direto no suporte às diferentes áreas de negócio internas – e estamos à procura de um(a) profissional com forte background técnico e experiência sólida em liderança para assumir este desafio estratégico.


💼 O Desafio:

Estamos à procura de alguém que não só domine o mundo dos dados, mas que também tenha a capacidade de liderar equipas e projetos, definir standards e boas práticas, e ser uma referência técnica dentro da organização.

Esta função será essencial na estruturação da nova área, garantindo a entrega de soluções analíticas de valor, alinhadas com os objetivos do cliente.


🔍 Perfil que procuramos:

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática, Sistemas de Informação ou áreas similares (preferencial);
  • 5 a 9 anos de experiência profissional em Data Analytics ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência comprovada em liderança técnica e/ou coordenação de equipas;
  • Capacidade de traduzir requisitos de negócio em soluções técnicas e estratégicas;
  • Fluência em inglês (escrito e falado).


🛠️ Competências Técnicas valorizadas:

  • Experiência em manipulação e análise de grandes volumes de dados;
  • Domínio de bases de dados relacionais e conhecimento de standards de metadados;
  • Experiência com ferramentas como SQL, Power BI, Excel Avançado, Python ou R (ou outras ferramentas de análise);
  • Familiaridade com ETL, modelação de dados e boas práticas de governance;
  • Conhecimento de metodologias ágeis e de gestão de projetos será um plus.


Se tens paixão por Análise de Dados e gosta de liderar esta oportunidade é para ti! 🚀

🔗 Candidata-te agora e vem fazer parte deste desafio!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Join a leading Retail Media venture at the forefront of innovation!




At Unlimitail, we are building the future of retail media in Europe and LATAM, combining Carrefour Links' immense in-store and e-commerce assets with Publicis’ advanced retail media technology. Our ambition? To become the number one retail media platform in Continental Europe and South America. Already partnered with 15+ major players since our Vivatech launch, we're set to welcome many more retailers into our growing ecosystem




Role Overview:




Within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail’s analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.

As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.




Your Mission:




You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries on a wide variety of topics:




Perform ecommerce campaigns analysis to provide detailed insights
Conduct end to end ad hoc analysis to help retailers best monetize their inventory
Participate in the design and maintenance of databases, using SQL to store and manage data efficiently
Work on automating data analysis and data visualization capabilities
Work on Unlimitail’s customer lifetime value calculation capability
Participate in the development of new, cutting-edge capabilities to create the best retail media products




Qualifications:




Master's degree in Data Analysis, business analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a related field.
First experience in data analysis
Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction.
Programming Languages: Python and SQL mandatory, any other is a plus
Data Visualization: previous experience in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Power BI or Looker is a big plus
Knowledge of GCP or Azure environment is a plus
Problem-solving: Adept in approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions.
Good communications skills in English. Another language (Spanish, Portuguese) is a plus.
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively




What We Offer:




🗺️ Work in a fast-paced, international, and innovative environment

👨‍💻 A flexible remote work policy of 2 days/week

🥐 Office located in the heart of Paris (Châtelet district)

🚆 You'll receive a 90% reimbursement of public transportation

🍕 Enjoy a 10€/day Swile card for each working day, we'll cover 60% of the cost




Ready to make a big impact? Apply now and be part of our innovative journey!




Unlimitail is committed to fostering a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from underrepresented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background.




If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support financial and regulatory reporting. You will work with large datasets, optimize data processing, and ensure compliance with financial regulations. This role requires strong SQL skills to analyze and transform data, but it is not a hardcore programming position. You will collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Reporting Specialists to deliver accurate financial reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process financial datasets for regulatory reporting.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and structuring.
Ensure data quality, resolve discrepancies, and validate reporting outcomes.
Translate reporting requirements into structured data attributes.
Support compliance with IFRS, Basel III/IV, Solvency II, ECB/EBA regulations.




What We Are Looking For:

3+ years of experience in data, finance, or IT analysis.
Strong SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.




What's in for you:

A challenging large-scale project.
International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

  • Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
  • Experience with Power BI is a plus.


What's in for you:

  • A challenging large-scale project.
  • International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (H/F/N)
Description:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world’s leading digital music companies. Believe’s mission is to develop local artists and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,020 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN: FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

ROLE’S EXPECTATIONS

As a Data Analyst Intern in the Product Team, you will contribute to the success and growth of many artists and labels. Your insights will directly shape the strategies that help artists grow their fanbase and reach new heights in their careers. You'll dive into cutting-edge projects, from developing advanced data models to uncovering viral trends that shape the music industry by analyzing impact of Believe’s partners, including Spotify, YouTube, TikTok, and others...

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

Creation and improvement of Power BI Dashboards:


design and develop dashboards to track the performance and accuracy of Tiktok viral trends detection data models,
follow the adoption of Believe products by artist, producers and internal teams,


Conducting Ad Hoc Analyses to support artists making the best decisions to develop their audience at every stage of their career, Turn your insights into actionable data models that will be integrated into our products, helping artists make informed decisions every day.

Qualifications


Demonstrated interest for the music industry,
studying in last year of a master’s degree from an Engineering or Business school with a specialization in data. Looking for an end-of-studies internship,
previous internship or student experience working with data or analytic topics,
proficient with SQL and visualization tools, Python a plus. Anyway, you are curious and fast learner, you love watching online tutorial until you become expert in a new coding language,
fluent in English, spoken and written. Comfortable working day to day in English.


Additional Information

Our interview process is designed to be as transparent and supportive as possible, giving you a chance to showcase your skills and learn more about our team. The process will consist of one HR fit interview, one case study to test analytic skills and two interviews with the team.

Ready to make your mark on the future of music? Apply now and start your journey with Believe!

Set the tone with us

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential… We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (HR Information Systems Analyst)




I am working with a client who are looking for a HR Information Systems Analyst to take ownership of all HR systems, ensuring data integrity, day-to-day operational management, and system upgrades. In this role, you will support the broader HR team with reporting and data analysis. The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role within professional services or a complex corporate environment.




About the Role

In this role, you will:




Manage data integrity across HR systems (People XD & Cornerstone) and related processes.
Lead HR system renewals, upgrades, integration projects, and new system implementations as needed.
Build strong vendor relationships with Access and Cornerstone to maximise system value, ensuring issues and queries are resolved promptly.
Oversee system management for the annual performance review cycle and promotion processes, including bulk uploads and documentation.
Provide training, support, and expert guidance to HR and system users.
Monitor data quality through consistent data capture, reconciliations, and regular audits.
Collaborate with Finance, IT, and other departments to support internal projects, including salary reviews, gender pay gap reporting, and D&I initiatives.




About You

You are an experienced HR Systems / Data Analyst with a proactive, solutions-driven approach.
You work effectively across teams, with strong communication and relationship-building skills.
You have an analytical mindset, excellent attention to detail, and strong organisational and critical thinking abilities.
You possess advanced Excel skills and can derive meaningful insights from data.
You understand the importance of confidentiality in this role.

Show more

Title: Global Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Company Description

The Data Strategy and Solution (DSS) team owns the research, creation, and maintenance of all 27,000+ distinct Label Insight attributes. This team is composed of industry experts including dietitians, food scientists, chemists, regulatory and product formulation experts. The Global Data Governance team within DSS is responsible for the quality and maintenance of our proprietary taxonomies: claims, certifications, ingredients, nutrients, and categories that are the foundation of all Label Insight data. The Global Data Governance Analyst is detail-oriented, able to make fast, but thoughtful decisions around NIQ and Label Insight data, regulations, and trends in the FMCG and grocery industries. You will receive on-the-job training for creating and managing Label Insight data taxonomies which will enable various LI-powered solutions within NIQ. Your willingness to use new NIQ platforms, learn new skills like data review, analysis, and coding will help build and maintain our data quality and, ultimately, enable customer health, trust, and new growth opportunities

Job Description


Manage the processing of globally sourced, English language data that powers attribution for various solutions. This includes on-package marketing text, ingredients, and nutrient data
Interpret, analyze, and clearly communicate our data and taxonomy structure
Audit, improve and develop internal database taxonomies
Expand our database to align with growing market trends and global expansion projects
Learn simple coding language to build and maintain LI attribute-powered solutions
Work with customer success teams to investigate and resolve customer inquirie


Qualifications


University degree, bachelor's degree or equivalent
Native speaker or high proficiency in the English language - both orally and in writing. Comfortable understand different accents
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint)
Comfortable learning new technology platforms (Coding, BI tools, GitHub, etc.)
Detail-oriented with the desire and ability to pick up new skills quickly
Comfortable with tedious and repetitive tasks
Self-motivated and able to manage deadlines and time on projects independently
Experience in data quality management, data review, or data cleaning is preferred
Technical mastery of:
BI and data querying tools and languages including: Looker, Power BI, Solr, SQL, and ElasticSearch
Internal NIQ tools and databases including: Label Insight NPE, Label Insight Explore 4.0, BB Product Library, and NIQ Discover
Internal Label Insight data management portals including: Digi, Taxonomy Management & Creation Portals, AMP, and others


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst Junior H/F
Description:
DREAM ENERGY et ARTESOL filiales du groupe ARTEA, sont des entreprises engagées dans la transition énergétique, axées sur le développement et la mise en œuvre de solutions innovantes dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables, l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique. Avec une vision centrée sur la durabilité et la préservation de l'environnement, elles s'efforcent de proposer des technologies efficaces et respectueuses de la planète. Grâce à son expertise dans les énergies solaire et hydraulique, les filiales cherchent à répondre aux défis actuels liés au changement climatique en offrant des solutions viables et à fort impact environnemental.

En collaboration avec les ingénieurs et les responsables opérationnels, vous aurez à charge de concevoir les outils permettant l’amélioration des analyses de données sur l’ensemble des métiers du Groupe, à savoir l’énergie (centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques, hydrogène, biogaz), l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique (infrastructures de recharge AC / DC pour véhicules électriques).




MISSIONS

Dans ce contexte, vous occupez le poste de Data Analyst Junior H/F et vos principales missions seront les suivantes :




Collecte et gestion des données

Assurer la remontée et le stockage des données issues de nos centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques et infrastructures de recharge pour véhicules électriques.
Contribuer à la gestion et l’optimisation des bases de données (Cloud ou Serveur physique).

Analyse et visualisation

Exploiter les données pour identifier des tendances et améliorer la performance énergétique.
Mettre en place des tableaux de bord et indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) avec Power BI ou Excel.
Participer à l’élaboration de rapports analytiques sur les performances des installations.

Développement et automatisation

Aider à la conception d’outils facilitant le traitement et la croisée des bases de données.
Participer à l’intégration de données externes (météo, prix de l’électricité, etc.) pour affiner les analyses.
Contribuer au développement et à l'amélioration des API pour l’exploitation des données.




PROFIL RECHERCHE




Formation : Bac+5 en école d’ingénieur ou université avec spécialisation en Data Science, Informatique ou Énergie.

Compétences :

Maîtrise d’Excel (VBA souhaité).
Connaissance en SQL, Python et/ou Power BI.
Bonnes compétences analytiques et capacité à manipuler de grandes bases de données.
Esprit rigoureux, autonome et curieux.
Bon niveau d’anglais écrit et oral.




CONDITIONS D’EMPLOI

CDI 39h/semaine
1 RTT/mois
Tickets restaurants
Statut : Cadre
Rémunération : selon expérience




Show more

  • Esprit rigoureux, autonome et curieux.
  • Bon niveau d’anglais écrit et oral.


CONDITIONS D’EMPLOI

  • CDI 39h/semaine
  • 1 RTT/mois
  • Tickets restaurants
  • Statut : Cadre
  • Rémunération : selon expérience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst HR Junior
Description:
Max Mara Fashion Group
An Italian House of Brands, Family Owned Since 1951.



Passion, commitment and tradition have created a unique fashion style: today 10 Main Brands and more than 60 different Collections find common ground in quality, style and respect for the distinctive feature that make Max Mara Fashion Group one of the most famous worldwide.



Max Mara Fashion Group, with more than 40 companies and over 5,500 employees, operates in 105 countries.
Our ecosystem is made of more than 50 Departments, including Fashion Design, Marketing, Operations, Retail, Stores, ICT, Architecture Design, Economics, BI, etc. in an Holistic approach to our Customers and leveraging all the new digital competences.





Job Description



The HRIS analyst collects, organizes, analyzes, and interprets data contained within the company’s HRIS (HCM Systems, HR Databases and more). He/She studies the data, and creates reports summarizing important findings. He/She works closely with other teams and stakeholders to identify data points that would be significant, and then perform data analysis to gather that information.
The HRIS analyst should be comfortable using programming languages, proficient with data analytics, and should have experience using tools for data visualization like Tableau,Power BI, etc. Familiarity with HR software programs is helpful. Strong organizational skills are required.
Reports to the HR Digital Manager/Coordinator





Qualifications







Manages the Information Design tools connected to Data Visualization (dynamic and interactive representation through BI dashboards)
Develops new knowledge from the analysis of the data it uses to inspire decisions and drive business
Create and manage standard dashboards and other information delivery services for internal customers.
Maintain and develop enterprise-wide metrics for strategic reporting and analysis.
Presents data and analyzes effectively to internal stakeholders
Uses statistical techniques to produce solutions to emerging problems
Develop customized reports to meet user needs.
Capitalizes on the use of insights, findings, datasets and statistical models for various business needs
Keeps updated on new tools and techniques of data analysis
Perform regular HRIS data audits to ensure system accuracy.
Team with IT to manage system feeds to vendors and other related systems.
Promotes the development of training/learning of the Role through self, digital and collaborative learning activities aimed at innovation and improving the effectiveness and efficiency of one's Responsibilities
Promotes, adopts and develops the use of technologies digital within its function in relation to both the management of the process and in relations with internal and external interlocutors involved in the business
Adopts significant behaviors and promotes actions linked to Sustainable Development, understood as the interconnection of practices oriented towards Environmental Care of Business Processes and Organizational Community

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bitsight is a cyber risk management leader transforming how companies manage exposure, performance, and risk for themselves and their third parties. Companies rely on Bitsight to prioritize their cybersecurity investments, build greater trust within their ecosystem, and reduce their chances of financial loss.




Built on over a decade of technological innovation, its integrated solutions deliver value across enterprise security performance, digital supply chains, cyber insurance, and data analysis.

We invented the cyber ratings industry in 2011
Over 3000 customers trust Bitsight
Over 750 teammates are dispersed throughout Boston, Raleigh, New York, Lisbon, Singapore, and remote




As a Data Analyst, you will work with a team in an exciting, agile environment to not only build organizational profiles but also identify how companies represent themselves online. We are looking for candidates who are focused, inquisitive, and can drive tasks to completion. The dynamic nature of the position requires a strong sense of collaboration and work ethic.




You and other team members will report to a Data Management Manager and will be responsible for the collection, organization, and quality of information gathered from the many different data sources. You will utilize custom-built tools and general Internet knowledge to build organizational profiles on companies across the globe. You will also have the opportunity to work closely with the Engineering, Sales, Product Management, and Data Science departments. The research you provide on business hierarchies, relationships, structure, and Internet presence will have a direct impact on customer-facing material.




Responsibilities:

Identifying the organization’s Internet presence
Capturing parent/child relationships within an organization
Provide high-quality data with minimal false positives
Effectively and efficiently communicate research findings
Collaborate actively and engage with data management work and other Bitsight team members




Requirements:

Proficient English communication skills, both written and verbal (English level > B2)
Analytical thinking, adaptable mindset, and customer-centric approach with focus on quality and attention to detail
Strong sense of team collaboration
Complete tasks and projects with a sense of ownership




Nice to have:

Knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT, Gemini)
SQL and Python
Customer facing experience




Diversity. Bitsight is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind and are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of your gender identity, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability.




Culture. We put our people first. Bitsight offers best in class benefits. We devote the same energy to nurturing our company's inclusive culture as we apply to serving our customers' needs. Working at Bitsight will give you the opportunity to fulfill your professional goals and expand your skills.




Open-minded. If you got to this point, we hope you’re feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don’t feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We’re eager to meet people that believe in Bitsight’s mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways.

Title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
Description:
SGS is the world’s leading Testing, Inspection and Certification company. We operate a network of over 2,500 laboratories and business facilities across 115 countries, supported by a team of 99,500 dedicated professionals with over 145 years of service excellence.




Job Description

As part of our Global Technology Office (GTO), you will play a key role in shaping and implementing our global data governance strategy. We are seeking a Senior Data Governance Analyst to drive the development and execution of data governance frameworks, ensuring data quality, accountability, and consistency across the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy aligned with overall business objectives.
Collaborate with key stakeholders — including business units, regional teams, process owners (labs and field services), corporate functions, and the data privacy office — to identify data owners and establish clear accountability.
Define and document data governance policies and data quality rules, ensuring consistent application across the organization.
Lead the implementation of a Data Governance and Data Quality platform to support governance frameworks and tools.
Monitor and report on data governance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data governance and data management.




Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Management, or a related field.
Experience: 5+ years in data governance, data management, or a related role, ideally in the testing, certification, or inspection industry.
Technical Expertise: Strong understanding of data governance frameworks and tools such as Collibra, Alation, Informatica, or Microsoft Purview.
Leadership: Proven success in building and guiding high-performing teams.
Certifications: CDMP, CISSP, or similar data governance/management certifications are a plus.
Tools Knowledge: Familiarity with data quality monitoring tools.




Skills:

Languages: Strong written and verbal communication skills in Spanish and English; additional languages are a plus.
Project Management: Ability to lead and deliver data-related initiatives on time and within scope.
Collaboration: Skilled at working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.
Analytical Thinking: Ability to translate complex ideas into clear, actionable steps.
Communication: Excellent ability to convey technical concepts in a clear and accessible manner, both verbally and in writing.




Additional Information

Why SGS?

Join a globally recognized and stable company, a leader in the Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC) industry.
Enjoy a flexible schedule and work model.
Access continuous learning opportunities through SGS University and Campus.
Collaborate in a multinational environment with colleagues from various continents.
Benefit from a comprehensive benefits platform.




Apply Now:

At SGS, we are committed to fostering an open, friendly, and supportive culture that thrives on teamwork. We value diversity and provide endless opportunities to learn, grow your expertise, and fulfill your potential. Apply now to join our motivated and dynamic team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Galway Hybrid

Duration: 12 Month Contract

Job Description: A Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics team is seeking a software engineer with experience in SQL, Tableau, Power BI, and BI Publisher. As a Software Engineer, your role is to create dashboards and reports to support business partners, as well as migrate reports from legacy platforms to new platforms as efficiently as possible.

Required Experience & Qualifications:

5+ years of industry experience as a software application engineer and developer
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent technical field
Ability to work independently and build communication and rapport with partners and stakeholders
Expertise in writing SQL using Analytical and Aggregate functions in ANSI standards
Experience working with Oracle 12c and above
Knowledge of VBA macros and ability to decode and rewrite into SQL
Experience with BI tools such as Oracle Analytics Publisher, BI Publisher, Crystal Reports, or Power BI Report Builder for creating paginated reports
Experience with analytical BI tools like Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of Autosys or any scheduling tool is preferred
Working experience with BI Publisher using Excel and Word templates is a significant advantage
Knowledge of Snowflake is a plus
Experience with performance tuning is a plus
Experience working in an Agile environment
Ability to take initiative, define a vision for product improvement, and execute with high quality
Ability to anticipate roadblocks, diagnose problems, and generate effective solutions

Skills & Abilities:

Strong data visualization skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to explain complex or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences
Strong prioritization skills within a dynamic and shifting environment
Ability to deliver solutions independently while working within a team of engineers
Strong client engagement skills with the ability to develop relationships and understand user needs
Effective collaboration with diverse individuals and groups in a constructive manner
Passion for automation, process improvement, and problem-solving
Creativity in determining optimal solutions for real-world problems
Willingness to challenge assumptions and explore alternative approaches
Enthusiasm for learning and delivering in a fast-paced environment

Key Responsibilities:

Understanding business users’ objectives and determining how best to deliver exceptional solutions
Recommending the right software tools and implementation strategies based on problem statements
Translating business requirements into technical requirements
Developing high-quality applications, user interfaces, and automation processes for business and technical users
Creating new applications, taking over ongoing projects, and supporting completed projects with maintenance and enhancements
Sharing knowledge and skills with peers to enhance the team’s overall impact

Impact of the Role: This role provides technology and support for portfolio management, research, trading, and investment operations. The team plays an integral role in delivering innovative, scalable, and industry-leading investment tools that enhance business capabilities globally.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

Passion, innovation and commitment are our values. If you love challenges and work in an international environment this is the opportunity for you!

Cooltra, European leader in sustainable mobility 🛵 is looking for a Data Analyst to join our data team.




Data team

We are proud that we have created a safe space where people can learn, grow and, most importantly, have fun. We celebrate our successes and failures and view everything as an opportunity to learn and improve, with no blame attached. The data team ensures data quality and provides reports and analysis to the overall of the company: Product, Marketing, Operations, etc.




Functions and Responsibilities

Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company stakeholders.
Work collaboratively across all areas of our business to make the most of our data.
Effectively communicate clear recommendations and actionable insight from data to non-technical stakeholders.
Build engaging and interactive visualizations with BI tools.
Define and analyze main Cooltra KPIs.




Requirements

Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related fields
At least, 1 year of experience as a BI/Data Analyst.
Mandatory: live in Spain and have a C1 level of Spanish.
Strong SQL skills.
Experience preparing, consolidating and maintaining data models
Experience with building and maintaining data pipelines
BI tools expertise.




Bonus Points

Good skills to communicate with stakeholders effectively.
Knowledge of best practices for a Data Warehouse management.
Previous experience with tools such as Airflow, Airbyte or dbt.
Experience in Mobility, Energy or Automotive industry.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken.




What do we offer?

Enviable working environment be part of an international organisation that values diversity and collaboration.
Full-time and permanent contract: 40-hours working week (Mon-Fri)
Competitive fixed and variable remuneration.
Full remote.
Flexible remuneration: through Cobee, we adapt your remuneration to your real needs, reducing your taxes.
Day off on your birthday: celebrate your special day as you deserve and enjoy a well-deserved day off.
Health benefits: health insurance with a promotional price, so you can take care of you and your loved ones.
Exclusive discounts for Cooltra employees: enjoy a 50% discount on all Cooltra services.
Personal and professional growth: access training opportunities to enhance your career and skills.
Additional offers and discounts: multiple offers thanks to our partners in services such as gym, restaurants, etc.
