Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO ARE WE?




We are PressEnter! A team of talented specialists trailblazing new pathways in iGaming.




Being bold and innovative are what drive the business to new levels, in such a competitive industry we understand this rollercoaster can be fast paced and a bit hectic. PressEnter will support you on this journey just as you support us!




Being a people first organization isn’t something we just say, we operate on a foundation of transparency, camaraderie and mentorship all whilst focusing on your wellbeing. You are a valued member of our team and we can’t wait to have you on board and part of a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion and an environment that promotes career progression and opportunities.




WHAT WILL YOU DO?




We are looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and supporting the whole business with insights, tools, and reports within our fast-growing organisation.




In this role, you will be focused on utilizing our BI tools and databases to provide valuable insights on our business performance and business needs to the business.




The role will entail building and maintaining dashboards, reports, and tools to support our business. This opportunity will allow a successful candidate to help shape our business practices and provide key inputs to our commercial team and allow them to make effective business decision.




A successful candidate will be motivated to improve our commercial business and have a mindset of driving improvements and accelerating others around themselves.




Oversee month-end closing of accounts and identify issues
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards and data structures within our BI system
Liaise with key stakeholder in the business for appropriate business support
Determine and verify internal systems and process operational data
Deep dive into data and identify and investigate trends
Administer all business units, analyse financial risks and recommend effective solutions
Reviewing business performance and reporting findings to stakeholders
Assist with the budget and forecast process
Assist with the preparation and evaluation of business cases
Analyse business processes and develop cost saving controls
Develop business processes, evaluations, analytical reports, and tools in order to achieve more efficient and effective work processes
Ad-hoc reporting for Management




WHO ARE YOU?




A minimum of 3 years experience in analytics or data science related field within iGaming.
Experience with forecasting and prediction models, player segmentation, and quantitative analysis.
Understanding of Tableau or similar BI tool.
Understanding of SQL databases and data structures.
Programming experience is a big plus (any language)
Industry experience
Strong ability to analyse needs of the business and communicate these needs to stakeholders and development teams.
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment.
Strong written and oral communication skills in addition to a skill for presenting sorting, segmenting, and communicating figures visually. Fluency in written and spoken English.
Initiative to work independently, but also able to work effectively with team members in different locations.
Flexibility and adaptability to business requirements and priority changes.
Excellent organizational skills




WHAT WE OFFER?




HQ in Sliema, Malta with fantastic sea views, shower facilities and open plan working space
Hybrid Model
Mental Well-Being Program
Friday social gatherings at the terrace
Team and Company events
Refer a Friend Bonus!
Combination of Private Health Insurance, Dental Insurance and vouchers
Discounted gym membership




If you want to be part of an exciting business and you feel that the above describes you, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Data Analyst (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)




Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Freelance Data Analyst to support our financial data operations in Brussels on a hybrid basis. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial data analysis, business intelligence, and reporting, helping drive data-driven decision-making within our organization.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large financial datasets to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and KPIs using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Work with SQL databases to extract, clean, and transform financial data.
Support risk analysis, forecasting, and financial modeling to guide strategic decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with financial regulations (e.g., IFRS, Basel III, MiFID II).
Collaborate with finance, risk, and compliance teams to provide insights.
Automate reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual work.
Communicate findings to stakeholders through clear visualizations and presentations.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).
Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, Macros, VBA is a plus).
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis (preferred but not mandatory).
Understanding of financial metrics, risk analysis, and forecasting techniques.

Soft Skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills to present insights to financial and non-financial stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
Ability to work independently while collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, investment, insurance, fintech).
Familiarity with financial regulations (IFRS, Basel III, MiFID II).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for data management is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested in this position, feel free to apply with your CV or email it directly to adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SEARGIN IS HIRING!

As a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate!




Currently, for the new Seargin project, we are looking for a Data Analyst.




Cooperation: B2B

Location: Remote work from Poland




The Domain Delivery Transformation program aims to unify and optimize this ecosystem of three product lines for a more streamlined and cohesive structure. The program will enable simplified and consistent end-to-end delivery and support processes in order to increase future agility and achieve cost efficiencies and a consistent employee experience.

This is achieved by consolidating a significant range of current fragmented managed services contracts, harmonizing and simplifying underpinning support processes and by leveraging a clear sourcing strategy for all contributing roles to the product enabling services within the SS&WE domain.




Role Overview:

Support data-driven decision-making by providing accurate forecasts and strategic recommendations for process improvement and automation.
Drive self-service reporting initiative using ThoughtSpot




Responsibilities for the position:

Generate data insights using trends and storytelling techniques to support decision-making
Identify areas for improvement by analyzing large volumes of data
Predictive analytics for budget forecasting and onsite support issues




Required technologies and skills:

Python
Tableau
ThoughtSpot
Snowflake
SQL
ML
Great storyteller




Other Needs for Resource Consideration:

Proactive and self-driven
Critical thinking




Discover the Power of IT Excellence. Apply!

To learn more about Seargin, please visit our web page: www.seargin.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer ground breaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.




Note that this vacancy is Remote, but our candidates must be based in Portugal.




We are looking for highly motivated and results orientated data analysts. Possessing proven expertise in Qlik Sense and potentially some Power BI knowledge. To leverage their skills to transform existing Power BI dashboards to Qlik Sense, ensuring the key purpose and insights required from the existing dashboards are available from the new Qlik Sense dashboards. They will work directly with senior members of the team and the Technical Team leader.

Specific Requirements

Certified or very experienced Qlik Sense user with demonstrable skills
An awareness of Power BI and AWS is beneficial
Exceptional ability to work with the business to understand the business process and reporting purpose
Excellent ability to translate existing data & dashboards requirements into effective new solutions
Optimal and efficient use of Qlik Sense to create visualizations; building sheets, create KPIs, build complex formulas, dynamic charts etc
Creates accurate, easy to digest/interpret solutions, adhering to internal guidelines
Collaborates effectively with the team to fill knowledge gaps and request support
Uses their initiative to problem solve
Proactively conducts test and validation of dashboard functionality & insights, ensuring data accuracy and integrity of the solution
Manages the UAT process by engaging with business users
Provides input and support to the wider team into best practice for report development
Engages with the wider team daily, scrum calls and meetings
Highly organised and well versed with agile development methodology
Exceptional analytical and time management skills
Exceptional communication skills




At Fujitsu, you will enjoy:

Competitive salary
Employment with the possibility of a permanent contract
Life insurance and private health insurance extensive to children for free and since first day of employment
Work life balance with part-time/full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
Several discounts available with our partners
Training and international career progression plan upon hiring
Dynamic and enthusiastic work environment with colleagues from more than 60 countries
The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
If you are moving to Portugal, we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
Remote Working Available
An IKEA voucher to help you build your own home office
…and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!

Learn more jti.com

Data Analyst

What This Position Is About - Purpose

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data from various sources to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions. This role focuses on web analytics and data analysis to optimize website performance, enhance user experience, and support marketing and product initiatives. The analyst will create detailed reports and visualizations, identify trends and patterns, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven strategies are effectively implemented. The ultimate goal is to leverage data to improve business outcomes and support the company's growth objectives

What Will You Do - Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze data from various sources, including web analytics, databases, and CRM systems
Monitor and analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar platforms. Provide insights to optimize website performance, user experience, and marketing campaigns
Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders
Create clear and compelling data visualizations to present complex data in an understandable manner
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data audits and validation
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to provide actionable recommendations
Work closely with internal Brand, Consumer Activation, Sales, Finance, Legal HQ/ DBU and IT teams, as well as with 3rd parties, digital agencies, web and software developers who contribute to aligned KPIs


Who Are We Looking For - Requirements


University degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Min. 2 years of experience in data analysis, web analytics, or a related role
English - very good (both verbal and written)
Proficiency in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy


What To Expect


Full-time employment contract
Professional onboarding during your first months at JTI
Individual approach to your development plan including certified trainings organized by both external and internal trainers
Opportunity to work in open atmosphere in modern office in a group of team-players
Attractive package of benefits, including among others private healthcare, sport-card, life insurance, pension plan (when you are here, check our cafeteria system!)
Work in a 50/50 hybrid system model


Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

Next Steps

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure Phone screening with Talent Advisor > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

At JTI, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you need any specific support, alternative formats, or have other access requirements, please let us know.

If you decide to participate in this recruitment, the administrator of your data will be JTI Polska sp.z o.o. with headquarters in Stary Gostków. Your data will be processed only to support the recruitment process in which you participate. Detailed information on the processing of your data here.

Procedure on internal breaches reporting and follow–up procedure for JTI Polska regulating the rules for whistleblowers reporting is available at https //do.jti.pl/sygnalisci.pdf.

At JTI, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you need any specific support, alternative formats, or have other access requirements, please let us know.

If you decide to participate in this recruitment, the administrator of your data will be JTI Polska sp.z o.o. with headquarters in Stary Gostków. Your data will be processed only to support the recruitment process in which you participate. Detailed information on the processing of your data here.

Procedure on internal breaches reporting and follow–up procedure for JTI Polska regulating the rules for whistleblowers reporting is available at https //do.jti.pl/sygnalisci.pdf.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Skill Development!




Work on impactful, AI-driven projects
Enhance your technical expertise in a supportive environment
Gain exposure across multiple business domains




Applicants must have a Stamp 4 visa or an EU Passport




Join a well-established Irish company known for its stability and commitment to long-term employee development. This is a unique opportunity for a Data Analyst to refine their skills in a collaborative setting while working across multiple domains. The company has a strong track record of retaining its employees, offering a secure and supportive work environment.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making, utilizing cutting-edge AI-powered insights and industry-leading tools such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Python. You will work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst with over 20 years of industry expertise, ensuring continuous learning, mentorship, and professional growth.




If you are eager to expand your expertise, contribute to impactful projects, and be part of a company that values long-term career progression, this is the perfect opportunity for you.




You will:

Utilize AI-driven analytics to enhance business efficiency and outcomes.
Strengthen your expertise in SQL and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies.
Translate complex datasets into actionable insights for key stakeholders.
Thrive in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment with strong career prospects.




Skills/Experience:

2–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with hands-on experience in Power BI and Tableau.
Excellent communication skills, to present insights effectively to stakeholders.




Salary / Remuneration:

€35.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Develop Your CRM Expertise!




Exciting career growth opportunities
Flexible and collaborative work environment
Enhance your technical skills in CRM and data analytics




This is a unique opportunity to join a highly regarded Irish organization known for excellence and innovation. As a CRM Data Analyst, you will be essential in delivering accurate reporting and valuable insights to drive strategic business decisions.




As a CRM Data Analyst, you will extract and analyse data from Aptify, uncover trends, and enhance automation processes. You will also provide data-driven support, working with Power BI, Excel, and CRM systems to optimize reporting and business insights.




If you are a junior data analyst eager to expand your expertise in CRM systems while working in a supportive and dynamic environment, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Manage and enhance reports and automation systems using Power BI.
Extract and analyse data to provide actionable insights – Aptify CRM.
Identify trends in customer and member behaviours.
Support team members with data-related queries and reporting needs.
Maintain and improve automation processes for efficiency.




Skills/Experience:

Proficiency in Power BI, Excel (Advanced), and VBA.
Experience working with CRM databases.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.




Salary / Remuneration:

€40,000 - €46,000

Paid sick leave, 20-day AL, pension plan, discount on gym, 5% bonus!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is the leading digital presence platform for multi-location brands, with thousands of customers worldwide. With one central platform, brands can seamlessly deliver consistent, accurate, and engaging experiences and meaningfully connect with customers anywhere in the digital world. Our AI and machine learning technology powers the knowledge behind every customer engagement, which is only possible through our team of innovators and enthusiastic collaborators. Join us and experience firsthand why we are consistently recognized as a ‘Best Place to Work’ globally by industry leaders such as Built In, Fortune, and Great Place To Work®!

We’re excited to share that Yext has recently joined forces with Hearsay Systems, forming a unified organization that is stronger than ever. This strategic acquisition enhances our ability to deliver world-class solutions by combining industry-leading digital presence management with compliant engagement solutions across social media, text, and voice. As we begin this exciting new chapter together, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to help us integrate and continue to innovate in our shared mission.

This role will be part of the Hearsay team, now an integral part of Yext.

This is a hybrid position, offering the flexibility of remote telework with the requirement to be on-site at least one day per week on average. Occasional adjustments may be made based on team needs or project demands.

This is a maternity cover position, estimated to last up to 18 months.

As a Data Analyst on the Value Consulting team, you’re passionate about translating a large volume of numbers into actionable business recommendations. Your work will help Yext customers and colleagues make more informed decisions; customers will better understand how to optimize their social media and compliant texting programs, and our company will continue learning how to better serve them in these efforts.

We’re looking for someone who has exceptional analytical skills, a passion for making customers successful, and a drive to get things done. Experience generating data insights that drive executive level stories and presentations is the core of this role, and your work will impact several teams, including your Value Consulting teammates, Customer Success Managers, Platform Reporting partners and Yext customers.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with CSMs to understand client needs, pull relevant data and generate visuals for key customer presentations
Work with various large reports to determine key actionable insights around data and user activity
Help drive data-backed “stories” – data analysis will drive key customer and company- level conclusions around areas of improvement, best practices, and program effectiveness
Determine industry-specific customer trends on social media effectiveness and end-user best practices
Work with internal Customer Success and Support data to find key improvement metrics on process and product
Help provide feedback to Hearsay Systems’ Product team on customer and company data needs
Collaborate with internal Value Consultants on data projects to help drive our customers’ ROI with Hearsay


What You Have


3+ years experience in a data-centric, analytical role
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to deliver multiple work streams on time with a high attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Superb Excel skills: data analysis, structured and unstructured data, charting and graphs
Excellent MS Powerpoint/Google Slides skills
Advanced knowledge of Looker or other data visualization tools
SQL skills a strong plus – pulling data from database directly to obtain necessary data
Strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects


Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.


Show more
HTML:
Yext (NYSE: YEXT) is the leading digital presence platform for multi-location brands, with thousands of customers worldwide. With one central platform, brands can seamlessly deliver consistent, accurate, and engaging experiences and meaningfully connect with customers anywhere in the digital world. Our AI and machine learning technology powers the knowledge behind every customer engagement, which is only possible through our team of innovators and enthusiastic collaborators. Join us and experience firsthand why we are consistently recognized as a ‘Best Place to Work’ globally by industry leaders such as Built In, Fortune, and Great Place To Work®!

We’re excited to share that Yext has recently joined forces with Hearsay Systems, forming a unified organization that is stronger than ever. This strategic acquisition enhances our ability to deliver world-class solutions by combining industry-leading digital presence management with compliant engagement solutions across social media, text, and voice. As we begin this exciting new chapter together, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to help us integrate and continue to innovate in our shared mission.

This role will be part of the Hearsay team, now an integral part of Yext.

This is a hybrid position, offering the flexibility of remote telework with the requirement to be on-site at least one day per week on average. Occasional adjustments may be made based on team needs or project demands.

This is a maternity cover position, estimated to last up to 18 months.

As a Data Analyst on the Value Consulting team, you’re passionate about translating a large volume of numbers into actionable business recommendations. Your work will help Yext customers and colleagues make more informed decisions; customers will better understand how to optimize their social media and compliant texting programs, and our company will continue learning how to better serve them in these efforts.

We’re looking for someone who has exceptional analytical skills, a passion for making customers successful, and a drive to get things done. Experience generating data insights that drive executive level stories and presentations is the core of this role, and your work will impact several teams, including your Value Consulting teammates, Customer Success Managers, Platform Reporting partners and Yext customers.

What You'll Do

  • Collaborate with CSMs to understand client needs, pull relevant data and generate visuals for key customer presentations
  • Work with various large reports to determine key actionable insights around data and user activity
  • Help drive data-backed “stories” – data analysis will drive key customer and company- level conclusions around areas of improvement, best practices, and program effectiveness
  • Determine industry-specific customer trends on social media effectiveness and end-user best practices
  • Work with internal Customer Success and Support data to find key improvement metrics on process and product
  • Help provide feedback to Hearsay Systems’ Product team on customer and company data needs
  • Collaborate with internal Value Consultants on data projects to help drive our customers’ ROI with Hearsay

What You Have

  • 3+ years experience in a data-centric, analytical role
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to deliver multiple work streams on time with a high attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Superb Excel skills: data analysis, structured and unstructured data, charting and graphs
  • Excellent MS Powerpoint/Google Slides skills
  • Advanced knowledge of Looker or other data visualization tools
  • SQL skills a strong plus – pulling data from database directly to obtain necessary data
  • Strong attention to detail, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects

Yext is committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture where every person is seen, heard, and valued. We believe in equal employment opportunity and welcome employees and applicants of all races, colors, ethnicities, religions, creeds, national origins, ancestries, genetics, sexes, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientations, genders (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), ages, physical or mental disabilities, citizenships, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. It is Yext’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law. If you have a disability that requires an accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, or participating in the employee selection process, please complete this form.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a specialist real estate consulting firm, is taking an innovative and disruptive approach to structuring property development deals. They are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to support data administrative tasks for a large, complex project with a US-based client.




Responsibilities:

Identify and autonomously reach out to global stakeholders to gather essential sustainability data.
Perform thematic analysis of findings, drawing actionable insights before aggregating data.
Assist in the creation and management of an initiative tracking tool for business use.
Handle data-heavy administrative tasks to ensure smooth project operations.




Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field
Proven experience with data-heavy administrative tasks.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Proactive, go-getter, with interest in sustainability




Details:

Start date: ASAP
Location: US-based (remote possible, close to EDT or PDT time zones)
Salary: $50,000 pro-rated Fixed Term Contract ($25,000 for 6 months).
Duration: 6 months

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At H2Ok Innovations, we're leading the charge in cleantech innovation, reshaping process industrials and manufacturing to drive operational efficiency and sustainability for our world’s most foundational industries. Powered by our H2Ok AI Co-pilot models and state-of-the-art sensors, our solutions optimize facility performance across various processes, including process manufacturing, production, water management, energy reduction, and waste minimization. Based at Greentown Labs, North America's premier cleantech innovation community, we're a woman-founded startup backed by renowned investors like Construct Capital, 2048 Ventures, and Flybridge Capital. Our groundbreaking technologies have earned accolades and adoption from industry giants like Unilever, The Coca-Cola Company, ABinBev, and Mitsubishi Electric. We're committed to unlocking untapped data for our customers, empowering them to gain a competitive edge and create Industry 4.0.

Transforming our most foundational sectors of society is hard. Very hard. But we’re building an empire. And empire building is not easy. It’s deeply fulfilling, and you will learn and grow tremendously while driving sustainable impact globally with some of the largest players that make everything we eat, use, and wear. Our culture is to foster extraordinary growth within our teammates. We believe in autonomy, ownership, empowerment, demanding excellence, being mission-driven. We believe in creativity, authenticity, and extraordinary growth. We’re looking for relentless, ambitious, creative, and exceptional people to join our team and build the factory of the future.

As our company scales, we're in search of a full-time Data Analyst to join our expanding team. As a Data Analyst, you will work directly with customers on high-impact immediate problems – interpreting, explaining, and ultimately bringing life to their data. Based on your analysis, you will use H2Ok’s ML platform to build machine learning models that drive value for our customers, saving them time, water, and energy. Your responsibilities will look similar to those of a hands-on AI startup CTO where you will work cross-functionally in sales, customer success, and product delivery to own the delivery of high-impact projects to global clients. The ideal candidate is an excellent critical thinker, a clear and engaging communicator, and knows how to not only explain data, but how to tell a compelling story. Having a background in chemical engineering, process engineering, mechanical engineering, or computer science is a plus.

What You Will Do


Analyze data from some of the largest factories in the world to identify process inefficiencies, anomalies, and areas of potential optimization
Interpret, explain, and shed light on complex data through engaging presentations and live demonstrations to customers and internal stakeholders.
Use H2Ok’s ML platform to train, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models to unlock additional factory uptime and deliver time, energy, and water savings.
Apply critical thinking and first principles knowledge to solve challenging, real-world problems in factories, breweries, food & beverage facilities, and more.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and customer stakeholders to ensure models are performant, reliable, and aligned with customer needs





About You


Fluent in analyzing, understanding, and communicating about data, especially time-series data or sensor data.
Willing to work directly with customers to explain model results, data analysis, and conclusions from data in a clear, engaging, and succinct way.
Skilled in data storytelling and visualization.
Can create engaging, colorful visualizations for customers that bring data to life and provide insight.
Experienced with presenting data and communicating results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experienced with Python, including numerical libraries (such as NumPy and Pandas) and familiar with at least one ML framework (such as Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX).
Familiar training, fine-tuning, and evaluating performance of machine learning models. Familiar with SQL or similar database systems (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Experienced with Git or other version control systems
Analytical thinker with the ability to solve complex problems efficiently
Excellent communication skills to articulate technical issues, solutions, and progress effectively
Adaptability to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving project requirements
Strong team player mindset, comfortable sharing knowledge and collaborating within a team environment
Familiarity with industrial processes and manufacturing industries such as chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and beverage, CPG, brewing, dairy, and industrial controls (PLC/SCADA/DCS) is a strong plus





Benefits


Direct impact on product and culture
Comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability, Transportation benefit, Health and Wellness benefit, and more
401k plan with employer matching
Equity
Competitive salary and bonus opportunities
Dynamic and inclusive work environment
Opportunities for growth and professional development
Access to Greentown Labs' extensive network of cleantech startups





Learn How We Think


Learn about our startup journey: Our Journey
How we're combating climate change: AI-Powered Climate Tech
A customer story: Ben & Jerry's uses H2Ok's precision automation to cut time & water usage





Why H2Ok Innovations?
Impact: Contribute to the transformation of the global industrial sector with cutting-edge innovation.

Growth: Join a fast-growing startup where you’ll have the opportunity to shape our content strategy. We value fostering extraordinary growth in our teammates.

Innovative Culture: Work in a high-performance environment that values empowerment, creativity, ownership, autonomy, innovation, excellence, passion, and continuous growth.

Sustainability Focus: Play a key role in promoting sustainability and Industry 4.0 advancements in manufacturing.

At H2Ok Innovations, we’re committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. If you're ready to play a key role in scaling a game-changing company that’s transforming the industrial sector and advancing sustainability, we want to hear from you!

Impact: Contribute to the transformation of the global industrial sector with cutting-edge innovation.

Growth: Join a fast-growing startup where you’ll have the opportunity to shape our content strategy. We value fostering extraordinary growth in our teammates.

At H2Ok Innovations, we’re committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Data Analysis Intern
Description:
Overview:

Draper is an independent, nonprofit research and development company headquartered in Cambridge, MA. The 2,000+ employees of Draper tackle important national challenges with a promise of delivering successful and usable solutions. From military defense and space exploration to biomedical engineering, lives often depend on the solutions we provide. Our multidisciplinary teams of engineers and scientists work in a collaborative environment that inspires the cross-fertilization of ideas necessary for true innovation. For more information about Draper, visit www.draper.com.

Job Description Summary:

Engineering Student internships support the research and development of new or existing computer systems (hardware, software, components, and materials) or may assist in sustaining and improving the quality processes across the full engineering and manufacturing life cycle. Student interns will contribute to projects in various engineering disciplines such as computer hardware or software design and development, electro-optical design, optical and thermal model development, bioengineering, materials testing, electrical system design, hardware assembly, testing, etc. Student interns will test and evaluate products, systems, or components and work with various applications such as LabVIEW, MATLAB, SolidWorks, COMSOL, ANSYS, Mentor Graphics, Python, and GitLab. Student interns collaborate with engineers or technicians to build and test systems, hardware, or components on various projects. They may also be involved in ensuring quality products are produced and quality procedures are upheld.

Duties/Responsibilities

Job Description:


Design, develop, and enhancement engineering solutions for challenging problems.
Implement, test, perform analysis, and provide documentation support.
Generate and present test reports including plots, tables, evaluation criteria, and conclusions from data collected and analyzed throughout the test process.
Complete assignments designed to develop a practical knowledge of processes, procedures, equipment, facilities, and systems as well as their interrelationships within engineering disciplines.
Performs other duties as assigned.


Program Requirements


Enrolled in an accredited full-time undergraduate or graduate degree program required.
There is flexibility regarding hours and program duration based on applicant’s school schedule and availability.


Skills/Abilities


Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent work ethic with the ability to work independently or in a team environment.
Ability to adapt to ever-changing environments, risks, and vulnerabilities.
Strong computer skills including MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel.


Duties/Responsibilities

Additional Job Description:


Provide technical assistance and support in data collection and analytics
Assist with building and updating data tools, i.e., supplier scorecards, customer surveys, etc.
Assist with connecting data between multiple software applications
Assist with updating the Quality Management System (QMS) sharepoint portal
Assists with developing metrics to monitor and improve the efficiency of operations


Skills/Abilities


Familiar with software tools, i.e., HTML, Python, Java, etc.
Ability to work on cross functional teams
Organizational skills and attention to detail
Time management skills and ability to prioritize tasks
Analytical and problem-solving skills


Connect With Draper for Future Opportunities! If you don't find the right posting in our Career Opportunities, you may submit your resume for future consideration.

Job Location - City:

Cambridge

Job Location - State:

Massachusetts

Job Location - Postal Code:

02139-3563

Our work is very important to us, but so is our life outside of work. Draper supports many programs to improve work-life balance including workplace flexibility, employee clubs ranging from photography to yoga, health and finance workshops, off site social events and discounts to local museums and cultural activities. If this specific job opportunity and the chance to work at a nationally renowned R&D innovation company appeals to you, apply now www.draper.com/careers.

Draper is committed to creating an inclusive environment. We understand the value of inclusivity and its impact on a high-performance culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Draper is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please contact hr@draper.com.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Geode Capital Management is seeking a dedicated individual to join the Data Operations Team as an Associate Data Analyst. The Associate Data Analyst will play a primary role in ensuring our key data assets are complete, accurate, and ready for use by the firm on a daily basis. The individual will triage issues as they arise, escalate when appropriate, and execute any required corrective action. Through investigation and coordination with teams across the firm, the Analyst is expected to proactively improve the quality of our data and processes. In this role, the Analyst will become a “go-to” expert on investment data sets while supporting Portfolio Management, Trading, Research and other internal stakeholders.

This is a hybrid work environment opportunity located in Boston, Massachusetts with a weekly in office schedule of Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays and remote work availability on Mondays and Fridays.

Who Are You?


Appreciates the criticality of good, clean, data, that helps drive business impact
Team player - willingness to help with any task needed for team success
Clear communicator who can explain complex data problems in concise language
Determined, curious, and industrious



Responsibilities:


Serve as operational data steward for multiple sets of data assets including Security Reference, Index, and Market data
Validate the day-to-day completeness, accuracy and quality of all data used in the investment process
Identify possible data anomalies and research the root causes
Triage problems and flag critical issues for escalation to appropriate parties both internal and external
Collaborate with colleagues across the business for clear resolutions
Develop metrics, validations, reports/dashboards to evaluate and monitor data quality
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data pipelines
Identify ways to streamline our processes and automate standard maintenance
Take ownership of data quality and integrity in new initiatives and projects across the firm
Perform operational duties to support both Technology and Business teams as required



Skills You Bring:


4+ years of related experience in investment operations
BS/MS (Economics, Finance, Computer Science or related major)
Strong technical background and the ability to work independently
Strong SQL experience (minimum 3 years)
Experience working with various asset classes including equities, fixed-income securities, and derivatives
Security, Index, or any other Master Data Management (MDM) Experience
Flexibility to cover the morning (6:00am – 3:00pm) or afternoon (10:00am-7:00pm) shifts on a rotational basis
Strong working knowledge of Excel, Databases, Snowflake, Python
High attention to detail and supreme quality, while balancing both practicality and value-creation
Experience with Jira or similar Agile management tools



Company Overview:

Founded in 2001, Geode is headquartered in Boston’s financial district, the center of one of the world’s most vibrant finance and technology hubs and employs approximately 180 employees.

Geode is a systematic asset manager providing core beta exposures across a range of equity and niche asset classes, with over $1 trillion in AUM. With a robust infrastructure and experienced investment professionals, Geode offers the scale of a large asset management firm with the benefits of a smaller organization.

Geode is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and support a diversified work environment. Learn more about Geode at www.geodecapital.com.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
When you join Verizon

You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the V Team Life.

What You’ll Be Doing...

We are looking for a highly motivated and results-oriented individual to join our team. You will be vital in leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and automate financial reporting processes. You will be responsible for developing Business Intelligence solutions to support the Finance department and other teams that depend on financial data. As part of a dynamic and expanding team, you will analyze internal data to identify needs for data products and facilitate the creation of reporting solutions from these data products. The role requires a strong understanding of business intelligence tools, data analysis, automation, and visualization, coupled with experience in developing and implementing reporting solutions using tools such as Qlik, Looker, Gemini, Google Sheets, Python, R, Knime or Alteryx.

Responsibilities Include


Develop and maintain business intelligence solutions to support financial reporting and analysis for the Finance department and other stakeholders.
Analyze internal data to identify opportunities for data products and create reporting solutions to meet business needs.
Drive the run-and-operate transformation initiative by providing an in-depth analysis of Verizon's financial data, including revenue, expenses, profitability, and customer trends.
Anticipate future business needs and build scalable solutions that address current and future data requirements.
Interpret complex business requests and translate them into actionable technical solutions.
Evaluate and provide feedback on reports and data visualizations.
Lead and execute reporting process automation using Qlik, Looker, Gemini, Knime/Alteryx, Google Workspace apps, Teradata, BigQuery, Python/R.
Establish and share best practices for building reports, dashboards, and visualizations, promoting a culture of self-service analytics with appropriate guardrails.
Collaborate with finance teams to understand their needs and create data automation and visualization solutions using a single source of truth.
Provide requirements to the data products team and translate cross-functional business requirements into data product requirements.
Stay current on industry trends and techniques to envision and implement innovative business intelligence solutions.
Participate in cross-functional project teams to identify and address reporting requirements.
Continuously identify opportunities to enhance data analysis, reporting efficiency, and methodology.
Collaborate with teams to establish clear goals and KPIs, execute tasks, and meet project deadlines.


What We’re Looking For...

You have a gift for taking unstructured data, organizing it, finding the valuable takeaways, and making it understood by others. You enjoy immersing yourself in a subject and becoming the go-to specialist. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day but you are organized so no balls are dropped. You view problems as puzzles you’d like to solve. You are comfortable working on your own but you also enjoy collaborating. You are a good listener and able to translate a business question into just the right analysis to find the answer.

You’ll Need To Have


Bachelor's degree in Finance, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant experience required, demonstrated through one or a combination of work and/or military experience, or specialized training.
Four or more years of work experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
Two or more years of experience in Teradata and Big Query.
Experience developing datasets on Qlik or Looker platforms.
Demonstrated knowledge of at least two: Knime, Alteryx, Python, Google Apps Script, and BigQuery.
Experience in AI tools and technologies.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:


Master's degree in Finance or a data-related discipline.
Experience in successfully driving large-scale adoption of self-service analytics platforms.
Experience supporting Analytics for Finance teams.
Expert understanding of Business Intelligence and associated disciplines.
Understanding all facets of data, including data engineering, data products, analysis, visualization, predictive analytics, and prescriptive analytics.
Experience working in a modern Data Warehouse using current technologies and services.
Demonstrate advanced knowledge and understanding of Telecommunication data sets – Wireline, Wireless & Network data set.
Proven experience driving change and achieving results in a fast-paced environment.
Proactive problem-solving capabilities.
Knowledge of advanced technology concepts like Teradata, Big Data, ML Integrations, Hadoop, Hive, Cloud, etc.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

Where you’ll be working

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Equal Employment Opportunity

Verizon is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to veteran status, disability or other legally protected characteristics.
Show more

  • Experience working in a modern Data Warehouse using current technologies and services.

  • Proven experience driving change and achieving results in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proactive problem-solving capabilities.

Where you’ll be working

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Equal Employment Opportunity

Verizon is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to veteran status, disability or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business. Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forcasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 2 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$94,900 - $117,000

We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$94,900 - $117,000

Title: Data Analyst 1, SRS
Description:
Posting Description

DATA ANALYST 1, Political Science , to join a team that is at the forefront of leveraging advanced computational techniques to deepen our understanding of politics; work to assist in the development of data pipelines, data models, and data operations infrastructure; employ a variety of technical tools to design and improve the LobbyView database; and help researchers and technical staff solve the most challenging computational problems in social science research and establish pipelines for queries and analyses, with other forays into relevant technical areas as time and curiosity allows.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED : Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, related technical domain, or in a social science field with relevant portfolio/experience; experience with SQL databases, especially PostgreSQL, encompassing query writing, server management, and database optimization; experience with Python, especially familiarity with standard web scraping, data science, and concurrent processing libraries; experience using and/or writing REST APIs; experience with Git or analogous version control systems; robust written and oral communication skills; and a minimum of one year of relevant experience in analyzing and modeling data sets and creating informative reports and dashboards. PREFERRED : A public portfolio and/or extracurricular interest in technical projects (e.g. hobby projects, open-source contributions, competitive coding, etc); experience with modern web development, such as applied experience with TypeScript; experience with other modern programming languages, especially R; experience with modern data engineering tools, such as DuckDB, Dagster, and dbt; experience with exploratory data analysis, data visualization, and dashboarding; experience with Unix/Linux-based operating systems, including bash shell scripting and/or Linux system administration best practices; experience with cloud technologies, especially AWS. Job #24883-6

3/12/2025
